title: The inverse Cox-Ingersoll-Ross process for parsimonious financial price modeling. (arXiv:2302.11423v2 [q-fin.MF] UPDATED)
abstract: We propose a formulation to construct new classes of financial price processes based on the insight that the key variable driving prices $P$ is the earning-over-price ratio $\gamma \simeq 1/P$, which we refer to as the earning yield and is analogous to the yield-to-maturity of an equivalent perpetual bond. This modeling strategy is illustrated with the choice for real-time $\gamma$ in the form of the Cox-Ingersoll-Ross (CIR) process, which allows us to derive analytically many stylised facts of financial prices and returns, such as the power law distribution of returns, transient super-exponential bubble behavior, and the fat-tailed distribution of prices before bubbles burst. Our model sheds new light on rationalizing the excess volatility and the equity premium puzzles. The model is calibrated to five well-known historical bubbles in the US and China stock markets via a quasi-maximum likelihood method with the L-BFGS-B optimization algorithm. translated_title: 用于简化金融价格建模的反向Cox-Ingersoll-Ross模型
translated_abstract: 我们提出了一种构建基于盈利率的新金融价格过程的公式。我们认为推动价格$P$的关键变量是盈利率$ \gamma \simeq  1/P $，是等效永续债券的到期收益率。我们用实时的$\gamma$以 Cox-Ingersoll-Ross (CIR)模型的形式进行了说明，这使得我们可以推导出许多金融价格和回报的特征，如回报的幂律分布，短暂的超指数泡沫行为，泡沫破灭之前价格的厚尾分布。我们的模型对于理解过量波动和权益溢价谜团有了新的解释。 我们使用基于L-BFGS-B优化算法的拟极大似然方法，通过对美国和中国股票市场五个著名历史泡沫的校准进行了加入$\phi$ -散度统计数据的实证分析。
tldr: 本文提出了一种基于盈利率的金融价格建模方法，使用Cox-Ingersoll-Ross (CIR)模型对其进行描述，并成功解释了过量波动和权益溢价谜团。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel method for financial price modeling based on earning-over-price ratio, called the inverse Cox-Ingersoll-Ross process. The proposed model successfully explains excess volatility and the equity premium puzzle and is calibrated to historical bubbles in the US and China stock markets.
